Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Vase
Description: Miniature tube-shaped vase with a flat circular bottom, a small flared foot, an asymmetrical body, that bulges at the bottom and narrows near the top. A large fragment is missing from the uppermost section of the body. There is a large accumulation of clay in the middle of the body, right below the missing piece. Forty-seven vessels of this type were found in the same foundation deposit.
